radioman is right,

Geofencing as nothing to do with a map control. Geofencing is a pure mathematical concept, it's backend computing. I do it using DotSpatial.Topology assembly. You can get the binaries and code here:

http://dotspatial.codeplex.com/ 

With simple linq query, you can convert GMapPolygon.Points collection to a Dotspatial coordinates and use GIS operation such as Intersect or contains (which is exactly geofencing). Here is a link to a thread I post on the Dotspatial forums:

http://dotspatial.codeplex.com/discussions/248193

Good luck!

I found a solution here http://www.codeproject.com/KB/cs/RouteGeoFence.aspx for a GeoFence, and converted to VB. If still you need the code, let me know bahrnb.
